result.execSummary:
The defendant Izabelle M Lackershire was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery (Substantial Bodily Harm With Intent To Cause Bodily Harm) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION/PROBATION:
Provide a DNA sample.
Pay all mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges including DNA surcharge.  To be paid during period of probation.  If revoked to be paid by defendant's prison funds at a percentage to be determined by the DOC.  Remainder to be paid during the period of extended supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Maintain full time work or school or combination of both.

No contact with victim.
No contact, must be at least 500 feet away from the victims residence.
Stay off social media.

Complete an anger management therapy.
Complete cognitive intervention programming.
Court sets restitution at $1200.00 payable to A.R.S. Joint and several with codefendant.

Court advised defendant of right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

timeConds.notes:
Report by 10/26/22 at 12:00 p.m.
Court grants huber privileges for work.
30 days are STAYED: to be used at the discretion of the agent.

charges.descr: Substantial Battery (Substantial Bodily Harm With Intent To Cause Bodily Harm)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Izabelle M Lackershire

records.addlTxt: 22A 096934/reapplied as restitution is J&S with 22CF199.

Defendant Izabelle M Lackershire in court.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court for Izabelle M Lackershire.  Attorney Alexandria S. Carlson in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Sentencing proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 2: The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 3 YEARS and 6 MONTHS, credit for 28 days time served. The term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 1 YEAR and 6 MONTHS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS. Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 2 YEARS.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION/PROBATION:
- Serve 6 months condition time in the House of Correction; 30 days are stayed to be used at the discretion of the agent. 
* Court grants Huber privileges for work.
* Report by 10/26/22 at 12:00 pm.

- Provide a DNA sample. 
- Maintain full-time work or school or combination of both. 
- No contact with victim.
- No contact, must be at least 500 feet away from, the victim's residence.
- Complete 60 hours of community service. 
- Complete an anger management therapy.
- Complete cognitive intervention programming.
- Stay off social media.

- Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA surcharges to be paid during period of probation, if revoked to be paid by defendant's prison funds at a percentage to be determined by the DOC, remainder to be paid during the period of extended supervision; failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

*Court sets restitution at $1200.00 payable to A.R.S., joint and several with co-defendant.
*Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program OR the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.
*Court denies request for expungement.
Received and Filed.
Received and Filed.
Received and Filed.

Defendant Izabelle M Lackershire in court.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court for Izabelle M Lackershire.  Attorney Alexandria S. Carlson in court for State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt. 
Case scheduled for sentencing hearing. For reasons stated, hearing adjourned. Court admonished defendant for arriving late. Court reiterated that all conditions of bail, including No Contact Order, remain in effect. Case adjourned, Branch 36.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report
filed.
filed.

Defendant Izabelle M Lackershire in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW
Case set for Plea/sentencing hearing. Case called with co-defendant Heislet 22CF199. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by defense counsel and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 2: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire/Waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire and jury instruction received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Criminal Complaint/Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record. 

The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    
Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.   

Case adjourned for sentencing hearing, Branch 38.

FILED: Plea questionnaire/Waiver of rights; Addendum to plea questionnaire and waiver of rights; Jury Instructions

**All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Laura A. Crivello, Branch 36,  in Room 313 of the Safety Building.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Izabelle M Lackershire in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Izabelle M Lackershire in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 38, Judge Wagner. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Defense request to be heard as to bail. Case is adjourned to Br. 38.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for February 10, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Court ordered no contact with Amariona S., and with the co-defendant.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.
  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Izabelle M Lackershire in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Izabelle M Lackershire in custody.  Kaitlyn Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 38.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
